description: The Spider Trio must do whatever they can to thwart Magneto's plans to free a number of evil mutants from prison.
name: The Prison Plot

description: Spider-Man is hired by a Hollywood producer to star in a movie about himself. Unfortunately, production is disrupted by a series of accidents and the lives of the Spider-Friends are in danger, thanks to the machinations of Mysterio, who also pulls the Incredible Hulk into the mix.
name: SpideyGoes Hollywood

description: When the mighty Thor shows up, the god of thunder teams up with Spider-Man, Firestar, and Iceman to stop Thor's half-brother, Loki, from obtaining a gem that will make him all-powerful.
name: The Vengeance Of Loki!

description: The Spider-Friends travel to another dimension to stop a sorcerer known as Modred from coming to earth.
name: Knights And Demons

description: The Spider-Friends go up against the Kingpin, who's attempting to get his hands on a new military weapon known as the Omni-Blaster.
name: Pawns Of The Kingpin

description: The Spider-Friends go after Captain America's archenemy the Red Skull to stop him from locating a hidden cache of high-tech weapons that had been developed by Nazi scientists.
name: The Quest Of The Red Skull

description: The title says it all.
name: The Origin Of The Iceman

description: A framing story involving the Shocker serves as a means of retelling Spider-Man's origin.
name: Along Came Spidey

description: The origin of Firestar.
name: A Fire-Star Is Born

description: Shortly after the Spider-Friends save swimmers from a school of sharks, they find themselves going up against the Sandman.
name: Spider-Man Unmasked!

description: In a nutshell, the Spider-Friends take on the king of the undead, Dracula.
name: The Bride Of Dracula!

description: Video Man becomes a good guy as he teams up with the Spider-Friends to stop Gamesman, a being determined to hypnotize young people and use them to carry out crimes for him.
name: The Education Of A Superhero

description: Spider-Man finds himself arrested for crimes committed by a scientist named Zoltan, who has developed a spider-serum that gives him powers similar to that of the web-crawler.
name: Attack Of The Arachnoid

description: An exploration of how the team came together for the first time.
name: The Origin Of The Spider-Friends

description: When a pair of time travelers arrive on earth, Doctor Octopus plans on stealing their vehicle so he can manipulate history to suit his own means.
name: Spidey Meets The Girl From Tomorrow

description: The Spider-Friends and the X-Men team up to battle Cyberiad, a cyborg that is intent on killing them all. They come to the realisation that Cyberiad was once Firestar's boyfriend who got half of his body turned into a cyborg as a result on an accident which he blames on Firestar.
name: The X-Men Adventure

description: A mutant named Lightwave is attempting to obtain control of a satellite, known as Guardstar, with which she can dominate the world. There is also an enigmatic relationship between her and Iceman that Spidey and Firestar are desperate to figure out.
name: Mission: Save The Guardstar

deck: The League expands its ranks and Green Arrow reluctantly joins. Green Lantern, Green Arrow, Supergirl, and Captain Atom halt a rampaging nuclear-powered robot in Asia.
description: The League expands their operations, enlisting new recruits across the globe. The newest of these is Green Arrow who has repeatedly refused to respond to invitations to join the League. He is therefore pulled to the rebuilt, and much larger, Watchtower by teleport. Opting against joining, he hitches a ride back to Earth with the team of Green Lantern, Captain Atom and Supergirl, who have been sent on a mission to stop a giant, uncontrolled, nuclear-powered defense robot in an unnamed Asian country existing in self-imposed international isolation.
name: Initiation

deck: Mongul holds Superman captive in the Fortress of Solitude by incapacitating him with a Black Mercy plant. Batman and Wonder Woman, having come there to bring him birthday presents, attempt to free Superman.
description:
Based on the story, of the same name, written by Alan Moore which appears in Superman Annual #11.

Batman and Wonder Woman find Superman held captive by Mongul in the Fortress of Solitude and dreaming of an idyllic life on Krypton, courtesy of a wish-fulfilling parasitic plant known as the Black Mercy.
name: For the Man Who Has Everything

deck: After Goku and Bulma begin their quest in full, they soon decide to seek out shelter near a valley. But, unluckily for them, that valley is in fact Skull Valley, a perilous place chocked full of danger but also home to one of the Dragon Balls! Meanwhile, the nefarious ruler Emperor Pilaf hot on the trail of the same Dragon Ball orders his henchmen to retrieve it. But what happens when they come across Goku? And...what else lurks in the dark?
description:
Original Title: !! (Arararaa! Tama ga Nai!)

Taking a break from their journeying, Goku & Bulma settle down on some grass. Goku is prepared to rough it and camp out in a tent but Bulma protests and instead withdraws a DynoCapsule and activates it, causing a fully functional house to pop up out of no-where. Goku is alarmed by this but eventually agrees to come inside.

As the two begin to relax, Goku comments that he doesn't like the food, and so ventures out in the wild to catch his own game, eventually crossing paths with Mai & Shu in the process and saving them from ravenous wolves as well.

Fully fed, having been ordered to eat his catches outside by Bulma, once he returns inside she remarks that Goku smells foul and suggests he take a bath. Goku is baffled by what the concept of a 'bath' might be, so Bulma agrees to wash him, and sure enough hilarious shenanigans ensue.

When morning dawns, after more shenanigans, Goku grows bored of observing Bulma carrying out her morning routine, so he decides to venture outside and train, soon coming across a rather curious visitor -- Turtle.

Finding himself miles from home, Goku agrees to return him to the deep blue drink, with Bulma following soon after.
name: The Emperor's Quest

deck: Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern are transformed into eight-year-olds by Morgaine Le Fey in order to fight her treacherous son, Mordred.
description: Mordred removes every last adult from Earth in order to have fun without their rules. Morgaine Le Fey transforms Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern into eight-year-olds in order for them to sneak back onto earth and stop Mordred.
name: Kids' Stuff
Excretion Without Honor And Humanity; Death Race 2010
Rock Lee is a Ninja who can't use Ninjutsu / Rock Lee's Rival is Naruto

series.name: NARUTO Spin-Off: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals

deck: Sabrina Spellman learns that she is a witch on her 16th birthday.
name: Pilot

deck: In order to stop Ares from loosing a weapon during a European Civil War, Wonder Woman must team up with Hawk and Dove. They face Aries, the deceitful Greek god of war.
description: Wonder Woman teams up with two super powered brothers, Hawk and Dove to stop Ares' plans to escalate a European civil war by loosing a war machine called the Annihilator into the fray.
name: Hawk and Dove

deck: B'wana Beast must prevent Wonder Woman from being slaughtered after the wicked sorceress Circe turns her into a pig.
description: The centuries-old enchantress Circe transforms Wonder Woman into a pig as revenge against Diana's mother. Batman and Zatanna work together to return her to normal, while B'wana Beast attempts to find the "Wonder Pig" before she's butchered at a slaughterhouse.
name: This Little Piggy

deck: Green Arrow, Supergirl, and The Question discover Cadmus has created a clone of Supergirl, named Galatea.
description: Supergirl, Green Arrow, and The Question investigate Supergirl's disturbing dreams. They discover that Cadmus created a clone of Supergirl named Galatea while she was recovering from her fight against Superman on Earth.
name: Fearful Symmetry

deck: While the rest of the Justice League fights Mordru, Booster Gold, marginalized by Martian Manhunter becasue of his constant publicity seeking, tries to close a black hole while on "crowd control".
description: The Justice League battle Mordu in the background, while the narrative follows Booster Goldas he attempts to close a walking black hole while he's supposed to be on "crowd control".
name: The Greatest Story Never Told

deck: Count Dooku arrives on Rattatak to witness gladiator fights; a force sensitive woman proves her worth.
name: Chapter 6

deck: Count Dooku confronts Asajj Ventress to a lightsaber duel to challenge her loyalty to the Dark Side
name: Chapter 7

deck: Obi-Wan and his troops take the fight to Durge and his droid raiders
name: Chapter 8

deck: General Kenobi and the ARC Troopers capture the Banking Clan's headquarters but Durge remains in pursuit.
name: Chapter 9

deck: The best star pilot in the galaxy battles starfighters above Muunilinst.
name: Chapter 10

deck: Storm is haunted by an African witch doctor who wants to gain control of her.
name: African Storm

deck: Avalanche wants to try being an X-Man, but has difficulty fitting in with the rest of the students.
name: Joyride

deck: A guardian angel has been sighted protecting people in New York City at Christmas time, warranting the interest of the X-Men - and Magneto.
name: On Angel's Wings

deck: Jean, Nightcrawler, Spyke, and Shadowcat are acting strangely, sleep walking in the middle of the night without memory of doing so.
name: Mindbender

deck: The Justice League tries to prevent Amazo from finding Lex Luthor.
description: The full power of the newly expanded League is unleashed for the first time while trying to keep Ivo's android Amazo from reaching his goal: vengeance against the recently reformed Lex Luthor . Luthor and the Atom attempt to create a weapon to neutralize Amazo's nanotechnology , though their victory is largely assisted by Dr. Fate.
name: The Return

deck: The Doctor, Rose and Mickey land on a space ship in the year 5000 then they find horses, robots ans 18th century France
name: The Girl in the Fireplace

deck: The Justice League encounter the Ultimen, who turn out to be clones made by Amanda Waller and the U.S. government.
description: The Justice League meets the Ultimen, a popular group of young heroes. The Ultimen discover they are the results of a government experiment in creating super humans and only have a short time to live. In frustration and anger, all but one Long Shadow strike out against the Justice League.
name: Ultimatum

deck: Forge creates a device that amplifies Nightcrawler's teleportation abilities. However, he ends up teleporting into a hellish dimension.
description: Note: This episode introduces Amanda Sefton.
name: Shadow Dance

deck: The Justice League battles self-replicating robots
description:
An alien spacecraft lands in Arizona and starts making lots and LOTS of bug-like machines from surrounding matter. The entire JLU bands together to stop it. Martian Manhunter fires the JLU satellite's energy gun for the first time to build a trench, but it only buys them a little time. They turn to The Atom for help.

Wonder Woman, Superman, and Doctor Light battle their way in through the hoard to deliver Atom to the center of the threat while others hold the line to protect the nearby towns.

This episode was written by Warren Ellis.
name: Dark Heart

deck: Beast and Shadowcat, as well as the New Mutants, travel into the woods for a nature retreat. However, their trip is interrupted when a group of hunters think that Beast is Bigfoot.
name: Retreat

deck: The Doctor and crew travel a year into the future by accident and then they find out that the it is a parallel world. Then one of The Doctor's most feared enemies turn up.
name: Rise of the Cybermen

deck: Some of the female members of the X-Men secretly become a group of vigilantes in the town.
name: Walk on the Wild Side

deck: The Doctor Vs. The Cybermen on a parallel world.
name: The Age of Steel

deck: SHIELD asks Wolverine to intervene when Magneto steals the equipment from Operation: Rebirth, the protect used to create Captain America during World War II.
name: Operation: Rebirth

deck: Mystique returns, bringing with her a powerful mutant from a mental institution: Wanda Maximoff.
description:
Notes:

  • Introduction of Scarlet Witch to the show roster.
  • The first of two episodes to include Agatha Harkness.
name: The HeX Factor

deck: Wolverine is kidnapped by a shadowy organization run by Bolivar Trask, who intends to test his new weapon - the Sentinel - against Wolverine. Meanwhile, Professor X is acting unusually tough toward his X-Men.
description:
Note:

This episode introduces Bolivar Trask.

This episode introduces the Acolytes and its members (with the except of Sabretooth, who has has appeared previously)

  • Colossus
  • Gambit
  • Pyro
  • Sabretooth
name: Day of Reckoning - Part 1

deck: The X-Men and the Brotherhood face off against Magneto and his Acolytes. Magneto uses Trask's sentinel to publicly expose the existence of mutants to humankind.
name: Day of Reckoning - Part 2

deck: The Doctor finds out how bad TVs are for you
name: The Idiot's Lantern

deck: A space station around a black hole and then trouble happens
name: The Impossible Planet

deck: A big and ancient demon turns up.
name: The Satan Pit

deck: A couple of college kids accidentally resurrect Solomon Grundy and the Justice League mount an offense to stop him.
description: This episode was written by Dwayne McDuffie and Bruce Timm.
name: Wake the Dead

deck: Batman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern follow Chronos into the past and meet heroes from the old west.
description: Batman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern chase Chronos to the past, where they team up with some of the greatest DC heroes of the Old West. After defeating stolen future tech in that era, they again follow Chronos to the future.
name: The Once and Future Thing, Part 1: Weird Western Tales

deck: Batman, Wonder Woman, and Green Lantern follow Chronos into the future. Ending up in a future version of Gotham City they team up with Terry McGinnis and what is left of the Justice League in that time period.
description: Batman, Green Lantern, and Wonder Woman chase Chronos into the future Gotham , just in time to face a battle with a group of Jokerz beside that era's Justice League. The time travelers are taken to the Justice League Unlimited refuge. An older Bruce Wayne reveals the street gang they fought together was enhanced by Chronos who led them to kill the rest of the League of that era. The combined heroes defeat the retooled Jokerz, and Batman traps Chronos in a time loop.
name: The Once and Future Thing, Part 2: Time, Warped

description: Black Canary and Green Arrow attempt to convince Wildcat to give up fighting in the MetaBrawl matches run by Roulette.
name: The Cat and the Canary

description: Big Barda and Mister Miracle request help from the Justice League to rescue Oberon from Apokolips.
name: The Ties That Bind (a.k.a. Miracles Happen)

description: After Doomsday is accidentally freed, Superman must stop him. Batman is injured.
name: The Doomsday Sanction

deck: Amanda Waller's team of super-villains, Task Force X, sneak into the Watchtower in order to steal an suit of armor known as the Annihilator.
name: Task Force X

deck: With the Xavier Mansion destroyed, Xavier missing, and their teammates in US custody, the X-Men must team up with Mystique and the Brotherhood to get their friends out of a base in Area 51.
name: Day of Recovering

deck: The senate is in an uproar over the revelation of mutant kind, and the threat they mean to humanity - causing Storm and Beast to go to them on behalf of all mutants. Meanwhile, the X-Men are forced into a confrontation with Juggernaut.
name: The Stuff of Heroes

deck: With Xavier back and the Mansion under reconstruction, the X-Men are trying to be accepted in the world. However, people still hate mutants, and want to do anything to keep the government form accepting them.
name: Mainstream

deck: When Wanda finds out that Magneto is still alive, she goes on a hunt for her father. When her brother, Pietro, refuses to help, she gets him arrested by the government.
name: The Stuff of Villains

deck: Mystique is out for revenge after Cyclops abandoned her in area 51. She kidnaps Scott, takes his glasses, and drops him in Mexico. Cyclops, blind, has to find a way home - and survive Mystique's wrath.
name: Blind Alley

deck: Spyke enters a skateboard competition. However, unknown to him, there is a new energy drink known as "Pow-R 8," which is toxic to mutants.
name: X-Tream Measures

deck: Wanda finds the headquarters to the Acolytes and, therefore, her father. However, unknown to Wanda, Magneto has plans for her.
name: The Toad, the Witch, and the Wardrobe

deck: Rogue suffers a mental breakdown.
name: Self Possessed

deck: Mesmero returns, now controlling Gambit to do his stealing. Magneto and the X-Men realize that there is a dark secret surrounding Mesmero and the items he wishes to acquire.
name: Under Lock and Key

deck: A mysterious figure with claws similar to Wolverine steals information from a SHIELD facility. Wolverine teams up with Nick Fury to discover who this person is.
description: Note: Introduction of X-23. Also the first appearance of the character in general.
name: X23

deck: Rogue is controlled by Mesmero to absorb the powers of various mutants, including those of the X-Men, Brotherhood, and Acolytes. Now, it's time for the three teams to work together to find out what's really happening, leading them to Egypt.
name: Dark Horizon: Part 1

deck: The X-Men, Brotherhood, and Acolytes race to stop the ancient mutant, En Sabah Nur - also known as Apocalypse - from being brought back.
description:
Notes:

  • Introduction of Apocalypse.
  • This episode and Cruise Control (313) aired out of chronological order. Dark Horizons Part 2 (312) serves as the finale to season 3. Impact (401), the first episode of season 4, picks up directly after Dark Horizons Part 2.
name: Dark Horizon: Part 2

deck: The younger students in the X-Men, chaperoned by Storm and Shadowcat, go on a cruise to get away from the bigotry they experience at home. But trouble seems to keep finding them.
description: Note: This episode airs out of chronological order. Cruise Control (313) takes place between Under Lock and Key (309) and X23 (310). The episode was later put in proper order in the DVD release.
name: Cruise Control

deck: After Apocalypse is revived and conjures up a strange force field around a pyramid is South America, Magneto goes out to confront the ancient mutant in combat.
name: Impact

deck: The Brotherhood try to become "heroes" because of the glory that comes with it.
name: No Good Deed

deck: Wolverine is abducted by Omega Red, but manages to escape into a forest. There, he finds his clone, X-23, who is also being hunted down by Omega Red and Gauntlet for Madame Hydra.
description:
Notes:

Introduction of:

  • Gauntlet
  • Madame Hydra
  • Omega Red

Omega Red makes mention of Maverick and Wraith.
name: Target X

description: Dexter's sudden inability to deceive has him pursuing a slick liar as his next victim, while Rita believes he's concealing a drug problem and forces him into a 12-step program where he meets Lila, a seductive new woman.
name: An Inconvenient Lie

deck: Charles Xavier's unknown son, David, is kidnapped by a mysterious and powerful individual.
description: Note: Introduction of Legion and his mother, Gabrielle Haller.
name: Sins of the Son

description: Rita finds herself threatened by Dexter's sexy new Narcotics Anonymous sponsor Lila, and stressed by a visit from her estranged mother, while Dexter tries to throw the dogged, intelligent FBI Agent Lundy off his bloody trail.
name: See-Through

description: Dexter discovers that the man is still alive who murdered his mother in front of him as a boy, and confronts the killer as part of his recovery from addiction - but he also discovers that old impulses die hard.
name: The Dark Defender

description: A new copycat killer openly mimics and claims to be inspired by the "Bay Harbor Butcher," driving the annoyed Dexter into the arms of Lila, a development that could spell the end of his relationship with Rita.
name: Dex, Lies, and Videotape

description: A written manifesto from the "Bay Harbor Butcher" sends the task force in charge of capturing him into chaos, which is part of Dexter's plan for keeping Lundy off his trail.
name: That Night, A Forest Grew

deck: Spyke returns as the Morlock's guardian, protecting them and any mutant who is being persecuted by humans.
description: Note: Introduction of Leech.
name: Uprising

description: Dexter decides that Lila is becoming too attached, decides "recovery" isn't working for him, and pays another visit to his mother's killer; Debra and Lundy find a clue that points to the "Bay Harbor Butcher" being right under their noses.
name: Morning Comes

deck: Gambit kidnaps Rogue, then asks for her to help him rescue his father from a gang in New Orleans.
name: Cajun Spice

description: Dexter tries to distance himself from Lila, but discovers she is not so willing to let go of their relationship; Lundy's manhunt makes Dexter nervous as he tries to stay one step ahead - but it's Dexter's worst enemy that learns his secret.
name: Resistance is Futile

description: Dexter's world comes crumbling down when Doakes tracks him to the scene of his latest kill and reveals a devastating secret about Harry; the Miami Metro PD closes in on the "Bay Harbor Butcher."
name: There's Something About Harry

deck: Kitty becomes friends with a Native American girl she meets named Danielle Moonstar. However, there is something odd about her.
description: Note: Introduction of Danielle Moonstar.
name: Ghost of a Chance

deck: Apocalypse begins his end game, prompting Xavier to confront him with the aide of Cerebro and Storm.
name: Ascension - Part 1

deck: The X-Men, Brotherhood, and every other mutant willing to lend aid help to finally defeat Apocalypse and his Four Horsemen - who happen to be Professor Xavier, Magneto, Mystique, and Storm, forcing the X-Men to fight against friend and foe alike.
description:
Summary

The X-Men, as well as allied mutants, split up into groups of four, where they must fight the individual members of Apocalypse's horsemen, who have been amplified to greater powers than they ever had previously.

Epilogue

In the series epilogue, Professor Xavier talks about visions of the future that he had while under Apocalypse's control. These were his visions:

  • Magneto helping to teach the New Mutants at the Xavier Institute.
  • Jean Grey being consumed by the Phoenix.
  • A new X-Men roster (Cyclops, Storm, Colossus, Rogue, Shadowcat, Iceman, Beast, and X-23). Rogue is seen flying, implying that she has Ms. Marvel's powers.
  • The members of the Brotherhood joining SHIELD.
  • An army of Sentinels led by Bastion.

The closing shot features the current roster of the X-Men. This shot features new additions to the X-Men roster, namely:

  • Colossus
  • Gambit
  • Havok
  • X-23
name: Ascension - Part 2

description: Dexter dodges bullets both figurative and real as he is forced to decide the fates of those he cares about most; Lila attempts to blackmail Dexter and makes a startling discovery that changes the nature of their relationship.
name: Left Turn Ahead

description: In the Season Two finale, Lundy and the FBI settle the case of the Bay Harbor Butcher once and for all but the heat's not entirely off Dexter as his world literally becomes an inferno. Can he rise from the ashes once again?
name: The British Invasion
Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
